secret_rule: Only items that share a common characteristic or ingredient with a dish mentioned in an episode of the "Great British Bake Off" can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "chocolate cake" and "lemon tart" and "bread pudding".

Okay, based on the examples provided by the game master - "chocolate cake", "lemon tart", and "bread pudding" - it seems that the secret rule is:

The items allowed in the game are different types of desserts or sweet baked goods.

The game master has provided examples of three different desserts - a cake, a tart, and a pudding. All of these are sweet, baked items that would typically be considered desserts.

Therefore, my best guess is that the secret rule is that the items allowed in the game must be some form of sweet, baked dessert or pastry.
